hero.title:
Ludovico
Latini
hero.subtitle: Cybersecurity Engineer, Penetration Tester, and Scripter

background.heading: Background
background.text: I hold a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and a Master's in Cyber Security, with a lifelong passion for IT security, programming, and Linux systems. My master's education also provided in-depth knowledge of machine and deep learning, leading to various hands-on projects in these fields.

skills.heading: Technical Skills
skills.text: I have advanced skills in managing operating systems like Linux (Debian, Arch, Fedora, since 2012), Windows, and macOS. I am a self-taught system administrator, specialized in managing centralized environments with Active Directory and virtualization systems like VCenter and Proxmox.

tools.heading: Tools & Languages
tools.text: I'm an expert in professional cybersecurity tools such as Nmap, Wireshark, Burp Suite, and Metasploit, as well as cracking tools like John the Ripper and Hydra. I have experience with reverse engineering (JADX, IDA) and develop scripts with a strong preference for Python. I am also active on TryHackMe and HackTheBox.

projects.title: Tor-Ip-correlation
projects.description: Simple server that is able to collect the IP of the user that are visiting the page. If the user visit the page with normal browser and Tor browser, the server provider is able to correlate the IPs.

projects.title: Are Flow Correlation Attacks Effective on Tor?
projects.description: A Critical Evaluation of State-of-the-Art Proposals
